channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.description:
Report E-2023080165

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report X-2023080563
item.description:
Report X-2023080563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: BOHEMIA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded from the inbound trailer and it was noticed that the box was wet. The package was brought to the Hazmat cage where it was put inside a plastic bag and left for QA to inspect. DescribePack: The cap on 1 of the jugs was loose and some of the contents leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was brought to the Hazmat cage and put in a plastic bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the gallon bottles of Nu Brite Condener coil cleaner was loose and the liquid leaked out and wet the box. DescribePack: no hole the cap was loose on one bottle DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Nothing

item.title: Report X-2023080520
item.description:
Report X-2023080520

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort, there was a jam on the NC belt, when a package handler went to clear the jammed package, this package hit against that one and fell off the belt crashing onto the floor. A manager came over and notified a hazmat team member that cleaned up the spill and placed it inside a yellow hazmat drum and put it under ventilation in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the glass bottles was shattered as it fell when it impacted the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was cleaned up with hazmat absorbent powder and then placed in a yellow hazmat drum and placed in the hazmat cage under ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2023080314
item.description:
Report X-2023080314

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found in unload with a wet spot on the box which had a hole through the box as well. After I found it, I brought it over to hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud. DescribePack: One of the jugs had a seal that failed and the lid was not tight on the jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought it over to the hazmat cage upon finding it.

item.title: Report X-2023080243
item.description:
Report X-2023080243

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. 1 container of Nu-Brite Coil Condenser Cleaner had a loose cap and leaked. Caps were then tightened and package was placed in protective bin. DescribePack: 1 container of Nu-Brite Coil Condenser Cleaner had a loose cap and leaked approximately 3 teaspoons worth of liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps were tightened and package was placed in bin.
